conclusion: To determine the speed of the elevator at t=60s, we need to analyze the given acceleration-time graph and the information provided about the elevator's motion.
The graph shows the elevator's acceleration as a function of time.
The elevator starts from rest at t=0.
The acceleration is positive from t=0 to t=5s, indicating the elevator is accelerating upwards.
The acceleration is negative from t=5s to t=60s, indicating the elevator is decelerating downwards.
The speed of an object is given by the integral of its acceleration over time.
The integral of acceleration over time gives the velocity of the object.
The velocity of the elevator at t=60s can be calculated by integrating the acceleration function from t=0 to t=60s.
The acceleration function is given by the graph.
The acceleration is positive from t=0 to t=5s.
The acceleration is negative from t=5s to t=60s.
The integral of acceleration over time gives the velocity of the object.
The velocity of the elevator at t=60s is the area under the acceleration-time graph from t=0 to t=60s.
